Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	This begins the words of Al-Baghdadi.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh children, I give you this book as a gift, which is the last of medical science, for the benefit of your health, and through its explanations, and thanks to its statements, in my view it seems fitting that I complete this treatise for you, which is part of my surgical operation, or surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the operation on oneself is confined to our region and in our times it's entirely private, there exists great danger with this knowledge, and its traces remain; and there would not have been a lot of progress without some small descriptions in ancient books, which rectify many errors and misconceptions where their principles are closed for understanding and extends the effort and skill required.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I should renew this treatise in a manner akin to exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and for the introduction of forms of the tools used like cautery and other equipment required for surgery, and for preparation thereof, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason why no skilled artisan operates on his own hand in our times might be that the art of medicine is extensive, and one must practice it before becoming proficient in the science of anatomy which Gualia described. He knew about the youthfulness of body parts and their forms, as well as their connections and separations; he had knowledge of bones, nerves, and glands, including the number of these and how to manipulate them; he understood pulsating veins and quiet ones, and the sites for their insertion.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And that's why Hippocrates said about it that in speech there is a difference, but more importantly in the work and especially in the art of one's own hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already mentioned this at the beginning of this book; whoever does not know what we have told about anatomy, should be avoided from falling into an error which would lead to many deaths, as I have seen too many cases like this, where some were trained in this science and abandoned it for that science and its experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	I have seen a skilled doctor who accidentally caused an inflamed abscess on the neck of a woman, and cut some neck arteries so that there was a large amount of bleeding, resulting in the woman dying among his patients.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I have seen another doctor who almost killed a man by removing a large stone from his condition, and the stone was big, it hurt him and he removed that stone with a piece of bladder, so that that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I already sought to remove it, and saw that due to the size of the stone and the position of the patient under him, he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I have seen another doctor who was paid by a duke of our land for surgery, and operated on a black soldier who had suffered from his fracture in the leg; due to the doctor's lack of knowledge, he removed the fracture, covering it with dust and plaster over the wound, without allowing air into the wound.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he let it heal according to his desires, and he applied bandages, and let it dry for several days as commanded that we loosen the bandage; and this happened also when bone and flesh were infected with abscesses, resulting in loss.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I sought help from you and prepared to remove the bandage, thus achieving calmness and alleviation of his pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But unfortunately the corruption had been confirmed in the limb, so I couldn't stop it and it continued to spread through the body of the patient, which was dangerous.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I have seen another doctor who punctured an inflamed abscess and it became worse for the lord of his patient over some days.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason is that the cold cauterization is pure of melancholy humor, so it doesn't affect everything, but rather it is a body part that suffers from being affected by everything.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, children, it is necessary for you that self-operation be divided into two distincts: one associated with health and the other where there is danger in major positions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already discussed this in every part of this book about the operation where there is error and fear; so it is necessary for you to keep this in mind and let that happen, so the pages don't accuse you of speaking or dishonesty.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And so take your tools in the service of God and for protection, and your patients with joy and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way through God's grace to gain salvation and a prosperous succession, let the terrible illnesses with difficult recovery stay away from your patients, keep your tools prepared for what you fear, so that stability remains in your faith and in your name; which is more lasting to your glory, better than in this world and at last in your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gualia already said in several of his writings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Don't treat bad patients with bad doctors," he said.

De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Regarding the use of a hot cautery and acute medicine, recalling the operation procedure.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	Here begins the treatise on all freedom.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Let me tell you about the quality of those cauteries and their consequences, as well as when it is forbidden to use a cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	So I say that the discussion about the quality of cautery's effects and its aftermath is long-winded and tedious for those with knowledge, subtle in science, and hidden by mystery; many wise men have already spoken on this topic, differing from each other, and for my part, it's enough to mention a small aspect of their teachings, fearing over-explanation.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And so I say that cautery strengthens the entire body universally in terms of its material or double materials, except for two components, which are parts concerning the double material.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the component of the tail and the body's dry part there is material; some say that cautery strengthens that, while others say its opposite, that cautery isn't suitable for ailments that are due to quality and dryness. For nature is quality and dryness, and it's inconvenient when an ailment's tail and dryness are cured by that which causes dryness and harm would be its cure.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the opposite argue that with cautery one strengthens youth in all tail and dry ailments that appear in men's bodies. When you compare a man's body and its humidity to the nature of fire, you find that a man's body is dried out.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say according to this discussion, which I have already discovered several times through experience.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, I do not wish for this to be discussed again in detail as it has already been elaborated upon in the section on cautery techniques and exercises, where one comes to know about the diversity of human bodies and the positioning of ailments among them, their causes, occurrences, accidents, and the timeline associated with these issues.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other parts of the body, there's no need for concern, especially with wet and cold ailments, which many doctors have already discussed about, not differing on whether youth from cautery is beneficial in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know this, children, that the secret of healing through cautery with fire and its good qualities lie in the use of hot medicines with cautery. For fire is simple, its action only reaches the limb being cauterized and does not spread to other limbs unless there's a small harm involved.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The action of hot medicines spreads to those limbs that are distant from the source, and it strongly facilitates the arrival of difficult-to-heal illness in the diseased limb and weakens it.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	And the fire, due to its simplicity and goodness of substance, does not do this except cause excess. We have come to know this through experiments and a long service in studying the art, based on understanding the true causes; for that reason, I justify myself from going into much detail about this topic. But were it not for the fact that these secrets concerning fire and its operation within bodies, as well as your expulsion causing maladies to leave, are not fully understood through philosophical demonstration alone, they would serve you well in these discussions.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know this, children, that there are disagreements regarding the time when cautery should be applied and they pause on the best period of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is suitable in any time period; because the harm due to temporary accidents is submerged by the youth brought about from that which comes with cautery, especially if it's used for pain or necessary pains that are strong and inflamed ones, which don't suffer from delay as feared by those that might cause mischief, which is greater than small harm entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And you shouldn't consider this in your discussions, or children, those who only estimate such things as the common folk and lay doctors do, it's true that for every ailment healed by cautery not all times are suitable, and they hold onto this conclusion.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason isn't simply this when they worry about it, because cautery is merely a form of medicine that alters structure and dries out the humidity which is causing the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	And however, excessive cautery over medicine due to its value and virtue of operation and the greatness of its master.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it's possible that the ailment could return at some point in time, depending on the structure of the body and the location of its ailment, as well as its virtue, and what is prepared within the body from adding superfluities to it, as well as what gets absorbed by it through food and similar causes; otherwise, if the ailment being treated with cautery is a subtle ailment in limbs with few superfluities and humidity, just like dental cautery for pain and similar treatments, it's possible that such pain wouldn't return within it, rather, this happens on a small scale.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And the common saying is that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it's an outdated term, not something I understand in this context, they believe it's not a cure that improves with medicine nor any other cause leading to cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the reason is against this; and I understand that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, but it's only when administering methods of treatment in certain illnesses, and those medicines do not work, then at the end of the cause, one administers cautery, and improves towards that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And here at this point, that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to my understanding which recognizes common and many doctors' views.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And it was said by the ancients that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they didn't say this merely due to the equality of gold and its limited substance compared to others.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And it was said that the place for cautery does not burn, as this is not absolutely true, I have already done this and found out that it does not do this in certain parts of the body rather than others; cautery with that (gold) is good and better than with iron too as they were saying; however, when you perform cautery with fire using gold, it has not been clearly explained, it's heated according to the quantity you want for the hardness of the gold, and to receive freg. And if you place the fire on it, the gold melts due to the heat; and in some parts of the fire, several sheets are heated so that the artisan can work on it.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this reason, when performing cautery with iron, you should do so more gently and more precisely according to the nature of the operation.

De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Regarding cautery for head pain due to coldness and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery process facilitates the cold and humidity to reach a sudden event of which there are two causes, they are caused by soda and multiplicity of traumatic flux, called corissa, from the head to the parts of the veins and ear canals, and multiplicity of sleep, and tooth pain and throat infection, and universally for all illness that comes from coldness, such as paralyticism, soda, stroke, and they are similar in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cautery is as follows, which we initially ordered the patient to undergo a liberating medicine in their head for three or four nights, according to what you require from the patient and their age and custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And afterwards you instruct the patient to shave their head with a razor, and then make them sit on a low bench and place their head on their feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the tip of your palm close to the pulse under the nostril between the patient's ears.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when you've reached the middle point as instructed, mark that location with a test, and then apply olive cautery oil which has this form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And place that (the olive oil) over the marked spot on the heated test, in such a way that it descends slowly as your hand is gradually constrained, and you rotate that.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And slowly lift your hand and look at the spot, and if you see some quantity of the head being exposed already, like the amount of grease in oil, then lift your hand. And if your hand doesn't turn towards that iron or another one, when it is cold, show me what I have told you about this head from which you can observe.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small amount of salt and dissolve it on the spot, leave that for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then apply it over the burned cheek in butter and leave it until the skin from fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with tetrapharmacon ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it was said that when the wound opens up, then the bruising improves, because it is better and more rejuvenating.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And it was said by them that the cautery is done inside the mouth, and the cautery should be kept until a part of the quality of the bone becomes hardened.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then make this mark that gets hardened from the bone, and then treat it properly.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And it was said by others that the cautery reaches to the end, within which one should take care of the bone's strength in order for the bone to come out, and this is the method for small cautery:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And consider that place where the vapor from the head escapes.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And keep the wound open for a long time, and then it should be cured when it becomes consolidated.

E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the thorn-shaped cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the treatment with cautery for soothing the throat eyelids.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the throat is softened by illness or moisture, then apply this lunar-shaped cautery to that eyelid. Here is how it should be done:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you do so, apply that treatment over both eyebrows with a small cautery on the entire area, and let them extend as far as the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And determine the length of each cautery according to the quantity of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but rather according to how the fleshy part of the eyelid gets heated.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the use of cautery on the eyelid when the skin turns into parts inside and on the hand.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the eyelid turns into parts inside, when I prick the eyelid, in this case there are two ways to use cautery, which is either to apply heat or to use a medicinal burning method.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you use a hot cautery, command the patient in front of it to let their skin grow as if those who undergo circumcision do, until they are extended and equalized; and if you have to pinch that area, then strengthen their eyelids so that they don't become damaged while their skins are being born.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then when they are born and equalized, then place the head of the patient in your position, and over the eyelid of their eyes apply a test, with a sign according to the shape of a leaf of marigold, and make the start of the sign close to the skin.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And place an embossed cut in the albumen of an egg or in pus from milk on the eyelid.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And apply heat to the cautery which is the form of this.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And apply cautery to the figure which was marked, little by little, in small patches, while burning the surface of the skin that is as if it were a leaf of marigold, all seemingly the same.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And a sign of the health of your work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and the skin of it lifted from the puncture of the eyelid.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And lift your hand and leave it for three days, then place the cut on the border in such a way that the scab becomes elevated.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And take care of that with ointment until it heals.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	And if any cause returns through the skin near their birthplace and the eyelid becomes softened, then do another treatment with cautery on that area just as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	And if the skin is in the eyelid remaining, then apply cautery to that area until it rises to its natural place and becomes equal, so that the skin does not hurt the eyelid.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And with the medicinal burning cautery, this means that you command the patient to let their skin grow until they are extended and equalized, then apply a pattern made of fabric in the shape of a leaf of marigold.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And take some known soap and a live ash. I., o let it sit this way, then mix those ashes with water and let it boil in such a way that it does not cool down; then spread the mixture on the fabric made like a leaf of marigold shape, place it over one eyelid or both; spread a cut in the albumen of an egg over this, and have the head of the patient in your position.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the described over the medicine and press it a little but do not damage it until the patient feels the bite of the medicine, which bite is like that when it's hot.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And when the hot bite is endured, then wash the medicine and remove it from your position; when the bite stops, then wash the medicine with water over the eyelid; and then observe if the eyelid has been lifted as if it was washed by water. If no return occurs to that place of the medicine on the spot where the medicine did not reach, and does not damage until your operation is equalized and the eyelid is contracted again.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And place the cut on the border so that the crust of the adjustment is eradicated, and then take care of it with final ointment or another until it heals.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And for this, you must observe with diligence during the night that medicine does not fall from under your eyelid, and if the eyelid becomes softened over several days and any skin cause pinches in the eyelid, then apply your medicine to that place where the eyelid is softened again, in the same manner as at the beginning, and take care of it until it heals.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the shape of a leaf of marigold.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	Know that men's eyelids are differentiated according to their size and smallness, so this is how you should contract them.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not hide the way of straightness towards that which is studied in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the treatment of a fistula that occurs in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with what we have discussed in the divisions of maladies and do not apply your treatment, then you should proceed to cauterize it like this: command the patient to place their head in your position, and have one of their attendants' heads between your own hands in such a way that they are neither damaged nor agitated by their own head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And place the cut on the surface of an egg white or in pus from milk over the eyelid of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And using the heat of the cautery of which this is the method:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	Which should be heated, just like a cane or reed pen form, from one end where the cautery is applied.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see, it penetrates into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want to remove it, do so like squeezing out.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But the one that is heated is better for this work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it has been opened, and heal and dry out what belongs to him.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not opened, then open that one and remove the pus from him.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place over him the heated cautery which should be well ignited, and hold your hand with your own one a little closer to the fire at the tip of the nose, so that your hand does not move and the patient is not disturbed. Then pause the cautery on the edge of the nose and clean that area.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if during the beginning of your cautery it enters into the nose, that's good; and otherwise, then you should repeat the cautery once or twice, as needed; and leave him like that for three days, and then place over that point on his forehead with some oil, within which there is a dried ointment to heal.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	And if it has been more than ten days and is not healed, then place over him the corrosive quick medicine into which the nose is exposed and shave according to what suits in his skull.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And another method for cautery of a fistula which some earlier authors said: look at the location of the fistula and make an incision there and place over that fracture a thin layer, whose form is like this: Then put in that area the quantity of one inch of melted lead; hold your hand well in place without harming the patient so that the melted lead does not go into his nose; cover where you pause on the nose tip with something soft like egg white or water, let the lead settle on the location of the fistula and heal it by a marvellous cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cautery and healing, that's good; and otherwise, then it is necessary to administer medicine from the nose and reduce the fistula into the nose according to where it naturally belongs.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On cautery of the wound in the foot.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Redness occurs causing cracks on the lips, and more so on the lips of children.

E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its shape follow the subtlety of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that initially in those cracks where the cautery penetrates into the root of the cracks.

Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On cautery of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the throat or on the palate or in the cavities of the teeth there is pus and you make a cut, and then it bursts, ages, cleans out that part and creates a fistula, then when treating that without deepening the treatment, heat the cautery according to the amount received inside the fistula, place that heated into the source of the fistula, hold your hand where it reaches the heated iron to the root of it, do this once or twice at its end; and treat that with what we have told you about healing until it heals.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And if the healing is removed and it heals, that's good; and otherwise, then it is necessary to uncover the place and expose the corrupted bones according to what comes in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On cautery of teeth and soothing of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are tender, treating those with medicines instead of waiting is necessary. So place the head of the patient in his own position, then heat the cautery according to this method, making sure you pause the small part over the tooth so that the heated point quickly reaches the root of the tooth without harming it from the inside.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand, and repeatedly apply the cautery for as many times as you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then let the patient drink water mixed with salt and keep that for an hour. Then wash that out, as when the tooth pain is reduced and the gum inflammation is alleviated and the moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the treatment of dental pain through cautery.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When dental pain is due to coldness or worm, or if you do not respond to medical treatment, then treat it with cautery in two ways: either apply a point on the gum of teeth, or use direct fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery on the gum involves taking cow's horns and heating them in a forge. Then take hold of it and cover it at the tip of the tooth, then immerse that into heated horn, and place it on the painful tooth as soon as possible until it is heated up.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then apply that several times while allowing the heat of the fire to reach the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you see that, immerse wool or cotton in the heated horn above it, then place that on the painful tooth and place a glowing iron over it while letting the heat of the iron reach the root of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cautery with fire should be done when the ember or iron is at its hottest point, and there's a roughness inside it, and the heat of the fire does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then ignite the cautery in the form that it will take, place it on the tooth and hold your hand over it until the cautery is heated up; and do this several times while reducing or completely alleviating the pain either on that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And so, because of this cautery that the patient fills their mouth with good horn and hold it for an hour, then they should swallow it; this is how the cautery works.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And treat with what you see as necessary according to what is possible for you.

E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit. De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the treatment of coughing and constriction in the throat.

De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On the treatment of a bump at the tip of the penis.

And you should heat the cautery in such a way that it enters from one side, and then from the other side; and the figure of the cauteryization will come as if with two cauterized points.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And that subtle one according to the amount of heat; and this is how it works:
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And some cases are adjusted according to this account, and these are the cauteries .viii.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	And place your hand on the cautery in such a way that there is salt residue, and then have the patient lie prone, and make sure the body does not get burnt for some time until it feels comfortable.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is above and towards the back, do this: then apply a cautery on the muscle under the cauterized point or on the bone's points, until the joint is confirmed and moisture is reduced in the patient's body, thus healing them.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter XXVI.
De cauterizacio del stomac.	On the treatment of gastric cautery.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When cold and wet humors accumulate in the stomach, causing a protrusion of its components and their multiplication within it, if you continue with the methods of treatment and they do not work, then it is observed that the patient lies on his right side, extends his hands and things, and applies a cautery there three times: in one cauterization place the foot as wide as the palm of your hand under a cauterized bone point, and in two cauterizations place each of the two sides of the cauterization between them until you get the figure of triangular cautery; and stretch out those that are not properly adjusted causing pus to form.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery is as much as the two fleshy parts of the thickness of the intestine.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And the figure of the cautery is according to this form, and if you wish, apply a large cautery in the middle of the stomach according to this form; this is a cautery according to the circular form according to this form:
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And the stomach should be cauterized punctually at that which is frightened by this cautery: and you place your hand on the stomach point according to the heat you want with the heat, then apply a cautery to it; then treat that with treatment that proceeds until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter XXVII.
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	On the treatment of colic by cautery.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When there is pain in the stomach due to coldness or moisture or excessive wind causing excess from its normal composition, and the patient does not improve with what we have said and it doesn't work, then observe that the patient lies on his back, holds heat three times according to this form over the stomach under the ribs, and you can continue until you feel comfortable in the lying position for a person.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let the space between each cautery be according to the size of the finger, and make the cauteries along the length of the body straight.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And don't touch your hand on the bone under the cautery.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the amount of heat that sticks is equal to the size of the thickness of the intestine wall, and it is not properly adjusted; and if the patient stands on their feet; and if not standing, then lie down, which already has spread their things, and raise their arms.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And it is possible for you to apply these cauteries with knife-like cautery tools when you have skill and caution in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And be careful not to overdo the cautery process, and ensure that the heat sticks to the entire intestine so it sticks throughout the body and reaches all organs, as this is due to the subtle nature of the intestine; know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On perforating stomach abscess with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When there is inflammation or an abscess in the stomach, and you want to know if that abscess is within the flesh of the stomach or around it, then if it's within the flesh of the stomach, the patient will experience increased gravity and pain intensity.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it's around the stomach lining, then the pain is intense and often tires the doctors in treating him.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Then observe that the patient should be lying on their back; and then place your hand over the location of the abscess with heat; and then heat up the cautery which is similar to a needle, as its form was described in another page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And apply the cautery there and within it until the entire intestine is heated up, until it reaches the chest, until you feel it heal.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with the cure of other abscesses until it is healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And do not use this method of cautery but rather the one that is prolonged as studied in the art of medicine, and with the most maladies associated with it; however, there have been some cases where heat has been applied to this operation, however, you should follow that advice, and it's better.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On the treatment of swellings with cautery.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	The ancient methods for applying cautery to swellings were done in this manner and you should follow this from the texts of Aristology. Take a long pointed reed found among the aristology texts that is as thick as your finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And then immerse that in oil and heat it over a fire, and apply a cautery at the place which is between the continuation of the shoulder blade up to the chest; and with two cauterizations leave it directed, one slightly inclined towards the part below the chin, and with two cauterizations in this area that is declining between the fifth rib and the spine, leaving one inclined to the parts behind; and another cautery at the midpoint of the feet; and another on the stomach, and three cauterizations at the parts behind; and a cautery at the place which is between the two shoulders, and two cauterizations on each side of the feet, leaving the cauterization that is in between the two shoulders.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And do not remove your hand from the area of the cautery, but rather in the process of its application.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And it is said by some old men who are among the people that use to apply iron-like cauterization with fire in this area which is between the ribs, up until we reach this place and heal it there as we have mentioned for this place of the wound.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	There should be no fear in this perforation with the cautery; it is just like what happened to you recently when you injured yourself at the site of the fistula where healing did not occur.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	On the application of the cautery to meat.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you treat the illness of meat as we have discussed in its division and do not apply your treatment, then using a cautery on it occurs according to three ways, all of which are perpendicular. One way is to make three or four lines in a row along the length of the meat according to the shape of the cauterizations in the wound, which I have already described.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And between each cauterization leave the thickness of a finger or even less, and the way to apply the cautery is the same as we have described in the cautering of wounds.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not remove your hand from the area of the cautery; and let the patient rest on their elbows.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	And there is another way to apply cautery; that means you ignite the cautery with two streams of fire, a fact we have mentioned in the chapter on dislocation of muscle. And raise the patient's body from behind so as not to let the discharge of the left thigh reach the area where the meat was wounded.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And your elevation should be at which you raise the body according to the length of the torso, so that the cauterizations are made according to the width of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And then insert both streams in the middle, ignite them, in that place where they penetrate from the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then remove the cautery; and thus four cauterizations are made.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you see fit, apply the cautery with three streams of fire.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And then you treat the effects of the cautery which has allowed blood to flow for too many days; this is preferable compared to other previous causes in treatment.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXXI.
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	On the application of the cautery to dropsy.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Cauterization should not be applied to dropsy but only in places appropriately.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When you treat dropsy as we have described in its division and do not apply your treatment, then you should use the following method: cauterize with four cauterizations around the belly button, one on the stomach, another on the wound, another between the two kidneys, two cauterizations on either side of the backbone, one on the right side of the leg, and another on the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the depth of the cautery should be as wide as the thickness of the body part being treated.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And then leave the application open for a long time until blood flows out properly.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not remove the patient from treatment near the cautery as it causes confusion and hinders the healing process. It should be treated with rest and aid for recovery.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the cautery which is applied to the abdomen should be elongated as per its previous form, and the area where the cautery is applied on the back should be like an olive according to its previous form.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter XXXII.
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	On the application of cautery to the legs and thighs.
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the legs are swollen with watery dropsy and filled with salty water, you should apply cautery to the back of the feet up to the area between the thumb and little finger. Lift your hand next to the cauterization and do not twist it; then lift your hand and do not return it completely as the salty water will drain out.

The application of the cautery is as follows: Apply two cauterizations on each thigh, and in every part place a cauterization at the tip of the knife-like extension.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And the application of the cautery should be according to the length of the thigh: hold one end and the other is in the middle of the thigh; on each thigh, two cauterizations.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	And leave the open wound for a long time as part of treatment so that some water drains out from it.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And then treat those causes which we have mentioned.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII.
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	On the application of cautery to the abdominal region.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When abdominal pain is due to wind and moisture inside causing digestive and retaining processes, they are within the stomach and in the intestines. This condition can be treated using standard therapeutic methods without causing harm; often, patients endure the exhibition of the disease's symptoms by undergoing a stomach cautery procedure. In this case, it is necessary to perform a large stomach cautery according to the sequence established during the gastric cautery process, followed by a circular cautery and four cauterizations in the area below the umbilicus, including subtle pin-point cauterization; and a large cautery over the navel region, or two cauterizations.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if you encounter excessively abundant moisture and the patient can tolerate it, then perform a cautery on the groin area and over the intestines, reinforcing your adjustments with two cauterizations on the stomach and close to the inguinal region. This is a complete cure of youth that will not fail.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Capítulo XXXIV.
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	On the cautery of ancient hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When dealing with ancient hemorrhoids of a large humor or corrupted moisture, if they are treated as we have said in the division and you do not cause harm to your treatment, then perform three cauterizations on each of the two small and triangular buttocks' pus points. Also, conduct one cauterization above the navel groove for two times.
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	And if you feel that the stomach of the patient is cold and the food they eat isn't digested well, plus if their face appears pale, then perform a large stomach cautery according to how it was done before; also do one on the tongue and another on the chest. Use a subtle pin-point cauterization for these procedures. Allow some time after each treatment for healing, and soon after this process, they should recover.
Capitol .xxxv.	Capítulo XXXV.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	On the cautery of the liver near the appendix.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you remove the liver, then you apply the cautery that is akin to fire.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Place the heated tool into that liver incision, and as you perform your work, ensure the cautery reaches the opening of the vein from which the disease spreads.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And do this once or twice; if the liver is too big, then cauterize each of them according to what we've discussed earlier. Also, cure those with treatments you administer until they recover.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you apply a large cautery to the liver, it will heal better during youth.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Capítulo XXXVI.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	On the treatment of fistulas that naturally occur in the parts of the body.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When nature does not conform to the treatment we've recommended in its proper place, and the patient is frightened by this, they should be treated with cautery.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	So when a certain one has a fistula in nature and it's ancient, full of sickly fluids, and contaminated pus, then that which is the essence worth discharging from it should be extracted with gentle probing. And you ought to understand the depth of its extent while conducting this probing process.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Place the cautery that resembles fire.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	And place the ignited cautery in this fistula, according to the depth of the probing.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And apply the cautery repeatedly inside until those corrupted bodies are consumed; do this one time or two times, or three times according to your need.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	And protect yourself from burning nerves and veins; or if the fistula reaches to the bladder's blood vessel or intestines, then protect all those areas. Do not perform this operation until you're sure that the fistula is in a fatty area and there's no possibility of it penetrating further.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	And treat the affected area until it heals.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the area has healed, and all substances have been removed from it, and they continue to do so for a long time, then you will know that it is completely cured.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the substances are not his own, then you will know that it is penetrating or in the vicinity of his organs, or that there lies a reason for this condition in those causes whose memory will return to him at that place.
Capitol .xxxvii.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	Regarding the cautery of the ears.
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When in the ears there is pain due to scratching or through great windiness, and when the patient's ear is reddened, then one should consider cautery of that on the ears with a cautery over each ear with a pointy tool whose handle helps remember the procedure.
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And for the second one, slightly apply the cautery, so that three linear cauteries come forth, and therefore they will be more at the back in youth.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXXVIII.
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	Regarding the cautery of the bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When it happens in the bladder due to scratching and wetness causing urine retention, if the patient cannot urinate, then apply cautery at that sensitive spot over the bladder, like starting points of the skin on the penis, and do so with a single cautery tool at that sensitive spot on the right side, and another on the left side.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	And the length of each cautery according to the size of the feet' nails; apply cautery with a tool at that sensitive spot on the lower part of both sides, or use two tools if necessary.
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And apply pointy cauteries according to how they are performed.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XXXIX.
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	Regarding the cautery of the throat.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.
